entry.title: Yuga Labs to Replace Logo That Apes a Kids Drawing Guide
entry.summary: Despite a market cap of over $115 million, Yuga Labs appears to have taken an unlicensed design for its Bored Ape Kennel Club logo.

entry.title: 'NFT Art Is Fairly Silly’ Says Casa CTO Jameson Lopp on Bitcoin Ordinals Rise
entry.summary: The rise of Bitcoin NFTs has sparked new outrage within the maximalist community. But for Casa’s CTO it’s time to grow up and move on.

entry.title: DAI Finds Its Spark With Spark Lend
entry.summary: A new lending platform spun up by protocol engineers at MakerDAO is looking to get the decentralized stablecoin DAI into more hands.

entry.title: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt: 'The Next Jeff Bezos Will Come From Web3'
entry.summary: The former YouTube Gaming head joins Decrypt’s gm podcast to reflect on his path into crypto and how it can all go mainstream.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Recover Modestly as Polygon, Filecoin, OKB See Blistering Gains
entry.summary: Crypto also caused a lot of consternation among regulators in Washington this week.

entry.title: Trader Makes $100K in Seconds Front-Running Token Listing on Binance
entry.summary: A trader whose wallet had already been associated with front-running token listings on Binance made over $100,000 in profit on Friday.

entry.title: A Stable Con: Key Takeaways From the SEC’s Lawsuit Against Terra
entry.summary: The SEC has filed fraud charges against Terra and its founder Do Kwon. Here are some of the more damning claims.

entry.title: FTX Warns of Fake 'Debt Tokens' Trading on Exchanges
entry.summary: A low-volume token trading on crypto exchange Huobi called "FTX Users’ Debt" is causing confusion among users.

entry.title: OpenSea Drops Fees, Cuts Creator Royalty Protections as Rival Blur Rises
entry.summary: The NFT marketplace will only mandate an 0.5% royalty fee for projects without on-chain enforcement, but allow sellers to pay more.

entry.title: Blockchain.com Shopping Assets to Fill $270M Hole From Three Arrows Capital: Sources
entry.summary: The crypto exchange and wallet provider had major exposure to Three Arrows Capital and conducted more layoffs last month.

entry.title: CZ Denies Binance Is Considering Delisting Tokens From US Projects
entry.summary: "Blockchain has no borders,” Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao tweeted in response to reports today.

entry.title: NBA Star Paul Pierce Hit With $1.4 Million SEC Fine For Shilling Ethereum Max
entry.summary: The ex-Boston Celtics star is the latest figure to be targeted by the increasingly tough-on-crypto SEC.

entry.title: Who's Eligible for Stepn's Latest Token Airdrop?
entry.summary: The popular move-to-earn crypto app STEPN is rolling out another airdrop. But who’s eligible?

entry.title: Blur's Token Airdrop Fuels Sky-High Gas Prices and Mass Ethereum Burn
entry.summary: A Valentine’s airdrop from upstart NFT market Blur has sent gas prices soaring and the Ethereum blockchain burning.

entry.title: What Are Ordinals? A Beginner's Guide to Bitcoin NFTs
entry.summary: The Bitcoin community has gone wild over Ordinal Inscriptions, but what is the new thing taking over Crypto Twitter?

entry.title: NBA All-Star Baron Davis Wants to Democratize Photography With Blockchain—Just Don’t Call It NFTs
entry.summary: The star athlete and tech entrepreneur will announce SLiC Images, a photo and video rights management platform.

entry.title: Judge Mulls More Electronics, Internet Restrictions for Sam Bankman-Fried
entry.summary: Prosecutors have suggested a ban on all electronic devices as well as restricting Bankman-Fried's internet access after he turned to a VPN.

entry.title: Japan Announces Launch of New CBDC Pilot This April
entry.summary: Japan joins a host of countries pushing ahead with plans for a digitized national currency, announcing a new pilot this spring.

entry.title: SEC Sues Terraform Labs and Founder Do Kwon For Securities Fraud
entry.summary: The commission calls out misleading statements regarding LUNA and Terra USD.

entry.title: Starbucks Polygon NFTs Are Already Selling for Thousands
entry.summary: Early Starbucks Odyssey users are already flipping the free NFT stamps for nearly $2,000 apiece ahead of the platform's public rollout.

entry.title: Binance US Moved $400M to Trading Firm Linked to CEO CZ: Reuters
entry.summary: Binance moved huge sums of cash from U.S. partner to a trading firm linked to Binance CEO, bank records show.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner CleanSpark Buys 20,000 ASICs, Expands Capacity by 37%
entry.summary: Cleanspark's new rigs will bring its mining capacity to 2.8% of the entire Bitcoin network by the end of May.

entry.title: NBA Top Shot Will Let Users Buy NFTs via Apple, Android Mobile Apps
entry.summary: Dapper Labs is pivoting to mobile—and working to help evolve Apple and Google’s approach towards NFTs and Web3.

entry.title: Coinbase Says Client Assets Are 'Segregated and Secure' Following Proposed SEC Rule Change
entry.summary: Coinbase says it already provides the protections available to the clients of qualified custodians and supports the SEC’s proposal to require such protections.

entry.title: Words With Friends Creator Previews Wildcard NFT Game on Polygon
entry.summary: In an exclusive interview, Paul Bettner tells Decrypt how Web3 tech makes the magic of his "ultimate video game spectator sport" possible.

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner: Web3 Can Solve Twitch's Limitations
entry.summary: Paul Bettner tells Decrypt about the challenges he faced while developing his Web3 game "Wildcard."

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner on Why He's Building His Next Game 'Wildcard' in Web3
entry.summary: Paul Bettner shares his perspective on Web3 gaming platforms and his vision to make games everywhere and anywhere players want them.

entry.title: Bitcoin Breaks Above $25,000 for the First Time in Eight Months
entry.summary: Crypto traders are shrugging off regulators, it seems.

entry.title: Collab.Land Reveals Token Airdrop for Over 2 Million Users
entry.summary: The token-gating tool used by over 43,000 DAO and NFT communities will distribute its new governance token to millions of eligible users.

entry.title: G20 Financial Stability Board Report Flags DeFi 'Vulnerabilities'
entry.summary: The FSB's latest recommendations take aim at DeFi, suggesting that regulators include the niche in their monitoring frameworks.

entry.title: Norwegian Authorities Recoup $5.9M From Axie Infinity Ronin Hack
entry.summary: Norwegian financial crimes agency Økokrim has tracked and seized a portion of the funds stolen in the Axie Infinity Ronin hack.

entry.title: GQ Joins List of Legacy Media Outlets Boarding NFT Bandwagon
entry.summary: Men’s magazine GQ is launching a new NFT collection, offering holders exclusive merchandise and access to its GQ3 community.

entry.title: Mango Markets Attacker Urges Court to Let Him Keep Hacked Funds
entry.summary: Avraham Eisenberg's legal team has objected to a January lawsuit that would see him return $47 million to Mango Labs.

entry.title: FLOKI Continues Musk-Fueled Rally, Soaring 62% Overnight
entry.summary: Elon Musk tweeted a pic of his pet dog Floki yesterday and pumped the price of the eponymous cryptocurrency by nearly 70% overnight.

entry.title: Binance Expects to Pay Fines to Settle US Investigations: Report
entry.summary: The world’s largest crypto exchange expects it will be able to settle ongoing regulatory investigations in the U.S.

entry.title: ‘You Are the Art’: Chainspace NFT Portals Connect Bitcoin and Ethereum
entry.summary: Like a Web3-native Snapchat filter or ASCII-based video feed, this experimental art project is minting NFT-based apps across chains.

entry.title: Fortnite Esports Star Wins Bored Ape Yacht Club Challenge
entry.summary: The “Dookey Dash” Ethereum NFT racing game has been plagued by cheating claims.

entry.title: Blur Advises NFT Creators to Block OpenSea in Royalties Battle
entry.summary: Riding high on the success of its BLUR token airdrop, the marketplace announced a provocative policy change.

entry.title: FTX Bankruptcy Judge Agrees Independent Examiner Would Mean More Risk
entry.summary: “Every dollar spent in these cases on administrative expenses is $1 less to creditors,” said Judge John Dorsey.

entry.title: Hester Peirce Says SEC Crypto Custody Plan Involves 'Substantial Departure' From Status Quo
entry.summary: The SEC commissioner joins Crypto Twitter in picking apart her own agency’s latest crypto proposal.

entry.title: Bitcoin Crosses $24K as Ordinals Takes the Network by Storm
entry.summary: New interest in Bitcoin has pushed the price to a six-month high.

entry.title: Ordinals Support Comes to Bitcoin-Based Web Wallet Xverse
entry.summary: With Hiro also prepping Bitcoin NFT support in its wallet, Ordinals' place in blockchain history seems secure.

entry.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesn’t Get Its Way, NFTs Popping
entry.summary: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event
entry.summary: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.

entry.title: gm: Kristin Smith and the Crypto Crusade in Washington
entry.summary: Kristin Smith is Executive Director of the Blockchain Association, which advocates for crypto policy in Washington D.C.—an exhausting effort that Sam Bankman-Fried was closely involved in, until he set it all on fire. Kristin tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott how SBF and FTX set things back, but there are still positive signs from crypto friendly voices in Congress. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Week in Review: Tech Layoffs, Porsche NFTs, Ted Cruz
entry.summary: In our January 28, 2023 week in review episode, Dan Roberts, Matthew Diemer, and Kate Irwin talk about more layoffs in crypto and broader tech (including how Google botched its layoffs), the NFT market rebound and Porsche’s NFT drop (fail or surprise success?), Sam Bankman-Fried’s latest claims about FTX US and the surprising list of big companies on the FTX creditor list, and Ted Cruz’s weird effort to get DC vendors to accept Bitcoin. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Web3 Is Disrupting Video Streaming: Myco, Theta Labs, and Actor David Bianchi
entry.summary: At an investor event in L.A. hosted by watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Sander Lutz moderated a discussion about Film3 with Myco CCO Phil McKenzie, Theta Labs BD Head Andrea Berry, and actor and filmmaker David Bianchi, whose Web3 series "RZR" got funding through NFT drops.

entry.title: How Web3 and NFTs Are Disrupting Film: Myco, Livepeer, Ava Labs, Bad Grrls Creative Club
entry.summary: At an investor event in New York hosted by the watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Dan Roberts moderated a lively chat about Film3 with Phil McKenzie from Myco, Toni Thai Sterrett the founder of NFT member collective Bad Grrls Creative Club, Doug Petkanics the founder of decentralized video hosting platform Livepeer, and Daniel Killeen of Avalanche blockchain developer Ava Labs.

entry.title: 'Iron Man' Comic Artist Sean Chen on Marvel vs. Web3
entry.summary: Marvel and DC Comics alum Sean Chen argues that while studios have made billions, comic artists aren't seeing even a fraction of that wealth.

entry.title: Marvel Artist Sean Chen on How Artificial Intelligence Will Shape Comics
entry.summary: "Eventually there's still a human brain that needs to be involved," Chen said of AI being used to create comics.

entry.title: Actor David Bianchi Previews His Web3 TV Series 'RZR'
entry.summary: Veteran actor David Bianchi spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson right before a public table read for Bianchi's upcoming drama series "RZR," to be distributed through Gala Films. The show is already greenlit and will be set in a dystopian future Los Angeles, with Ethereum and other digital assets as part of the plot. Bianchi also conducted two NFT drops to build engagement from fans.

entry.title: gm: Farokh and the Rug Radio Roadmap
entry.summary: Meet Mr. NFT: @Farokh, who preaches daily to hundreds of thousands of NFT faithful, and is trying to building Rug Radio into a fully formed Web3 media company. Dan Roberts and Kate Irwin from the gm podcast talk to Farokh about Rug DAO and all things NFT culture. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
